text: [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Dark brown hazy. Cola, roastedness, juniper twigs and sweet malts. Strangely dry body, sort of roasty rubbery finish (almost schwarz- like). Herby, twigsy, bit messy body. Some penicillin, grains. Has a lot more structure than your typical sahti, more ale-like. Dunno if thats good or bad.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

At St.Urhos Sahtipäivät 2014. Hazy brown, thin off white head. Sweet raisiny, juniper, yeasty aroma. Flavor has sweetness, juniper, soda, soaked raisins. Long sweet finish, hint of alcohol. Tasty.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

Hazy mahogany brown,  practically no head. Malty aroma has bit Belgian nuances, sweet, bit sour, berries,  bit perfume like. Bit banana, herbs, yeast, intersting flavors, sweet, medium body, low carbonation,  tasty long finish. Tasty one, nuanced and lively.
Tap at St Urho, Helsinki. Sahtiviikot 2013. Colour is hazy light brown with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Banana, grain, yeast and fruits.

Plastic cask @ Naamat, Tampere.
Originally rated on 20100522.
Pours murky brown color with a minimal head. Aroma of ripe fruits, mild juniper notes, grass and yeast. Flavor of yeast, juniper, mild spices and hay. Good.
Mild nose. No head. Dark black color. Soft full filled  slightly coffeyish and syropy taste with some hints of licorice. Mild hops. Urhon sahtipäivät 2012

UPDATED: JAN 19, 2014 
Plastic cask @ Kahdet Kasvot. Rated on 22.05.2010
Aroma is somewhat sweet with banana esthers, berries and licorice. Surprisingly the flavour is not sweet as sahtis usually are. It has anise, licorice, some strawberries and yeasty notes. Clean, solid and good sahti. Actually one of the best Ive had, but glasses of Hollola and Pihamaa Ive had in this very same place were even better.
Amber body, small white head. Aroma of sweet malt and smoke. Flavour ahs also some fruits, raisins. Thin for a sahti.

Draught at St Urhos, Helsinki, Finland.
Hazy amber colour with almost no head.
Burned rye malt and burned rubber in aroma. Sweet caramel malt in flavour. Medium carbonation. Not very Sahti like.

On  tap at Urhos Pub, Helsinki. Poured hazy dark orange in colour with no head. Burnt wood and smoke in aroma with some light fruitiness as well. Flavour a bit smokey with some yeasty notes. Quite heavy mouthfeel. Strong burnt wood in the beginning, ending was more pleasant.

Tap @ Kahdet Kasvot. Rated @ 22.5.2010.
Hazy brown colour with a minimal white head. Very beautiful appearance. The aroma is weak with banana, juniper and wheat. Flavour is a bit better as the body shows itself; wheat, banana, hops and caramel. Medium bodied, slicky to watery mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Pleasant.

On tap. Pours hazy brown with small off-white head; sweet bananish and slightly berryish aroma; flavor is sweet, quite fruity, a bit crisp, junipery in the finish; medium to full-bodied with very low carbonation.

(Draught at St. Urhos Pub Sahti Days 09) Dark brown and cloudy. Small white head. Malts and  banana in aroma. Full bodied palate with medium carbonation. Banana, malts, bitterness, fruitiness, sweetness, lightly chocolate and tar in taste. Sweet aftertaste.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Hunters, Pori. Hazy dark nutbrown colour, mediumsized daerk beige head. Aroma is banana, juniper. some caramel and some slight bittering notes. Flavour is juniper, caramel, some bitter & sourness. Also a lot of banana. Long junipery aftertaste. A quite dry Sahti. One of the more pleasant Sahtis Ive had.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2009 Draught (St. Urhos, Helsinki, ).
Thick muddy brown or caramel turbidity - as expected from sahti.
Not as much banana aroma as expected  Thick and sweet on the tongue, leaves a long richly roasted malt taste with a HUGE bitter and juniper finish. Excellent sahti. Final note - I did notice a bitter almond-like taste at the end. (7-3-8-4-14=3.6)
Rerate: 2009 version, Keg (St. Urhos, Helsinki, Sahti Days 2009)
(7-4-8-4-15=3.8) Rich banana aroma, sweet and treacly. Soft carbonation, some crispness. Loads of retronasal esters, banana by the bucketload. Pleasant sahti taste, all the sticky malts and banana, lots of juniper too. However, the sting is in the tail - this has lovely hops in the finish.

Draught @ Beer Hunters
Murky nut brown, creamy brown head. Sticky sugary, notes of juniper in the flavor. A bit citrusy. Light-bodied, refreshing easy to drink sahti. Hides alcohol very well. One of the best sahtis I have tasted but looks like it does not travel very well.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2009 ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */) Murky medium-brown with no head. Aroma of slightly sweet maltiness and some anise-licorice notes. Flavor is only slightly sweet, a bit stingy-spicy flavor with a touch of floweriness. Medium to full body with no carbonation. A quite balanced and spicy sahti. Quite yeasty still, so might be better tomorrow after its been settled a bit.
(Draught, was 8-3-7-4-15=3.7) Murky orange-brown color with almost no head. Sweetish, quite smooth and pleasant banana-fruity aroma. Flowery-perfumy, sweet-sourish flavor with some vegetable hints. Very well-hidden alcohol. Sticky-sugary finish. Medium-bodied with low carbonation. This time it seemed to be in shape, and not bad at all (last rating was 2.2 because of sulphur).
